title: Dense fog engulfs north India, flight operations at Delhi airport hit - Hindustan Times
summary:
Dense Fog Disrupts Flight Operations at Delhi Airport

Date: Jan 04, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Dense fog has severely impacted flight operations at Delhi International Airport, leading to a halt in departures and arrivals. Visibility was reduced to zero, affecting not only air travel but also road traffic across Delhi and neighboring states.

  • Flight operations at Delhi airport were significantly disrupted due to dense fog.
  • IndiGo announced a temporary halt on all flights due to visibility issues.
  • Air India reported similar disruptions affecting northern India.
  • More than 400 flights were delayed as a consequence of the weather conditions.
  • The visibility at Indira Gandhi International Airport was recorded at 0 meters.
"Passengers are requested to contact the airline concerned for updated flight information. Any inconvenience caused is deeply regretted," DIAL posted.

The article highlights the significant impact of weather conditions on travel plans, with authorities advising passengers to stay informed about flight statuses.
newTitle: Dense Fog Disrupts Flight Operations at Delhi Airport

title: Budget 2025: Income Tax Cut Likely; Know Current Rates, Slabs Under New Tax Regime Vs Old Tax Regime - News18
summary:
Budget 2025: Income Tax Cut Likely; Know Current Rates, Slabs Under New Tax Regime Vs Old Tax Regime

Last Updated: January 03, 2025, 18:42 IST

As India prepares for the Union Budget 2025-26 announcement, income tax changes are highly anticipated, particularly potential reductions for earners up to Rs 15 lakh annually.

Key Points:

  • The New Tax Regime offers lower rates without exemptions and deductions.
  • The Old Tax Regime allows for various exemptions and deductions for higher tax rates.
  • Current tax slabs under the New Regime range from nil for income up to Rs 3 lakh to 30% for income above Rs 15 lakh.
  • The Old Regime starts with nil for income up to Rs 2.5 lakh and also has a slab for senior citizens with a higher exemption limit.
  • Expectations include possible hikes in basic exemption limits to support middle-income groups.
“From a perspective of boosting consumption, we have suggested that there be some relief provided to income tax up to a Rs 20 lakh on the marginal income tax rate...” - Sanjiv Puri, CII Chairman

The upcoming budget may introduce changes in tax structures that could promote economic buoyancy and provide incentives for lower-income earners.
newTitle: Budget 2025: Anticipated Income Tax Cuts and Current Tax Rates

title: Video: Navy Officers Fall In Beach After Parachute Mix-Up In Andhra Pradesh - News18
summary:
Navy Officers Fall into Beach After Parachute Miscommunication in Andhra Pradesh

Date: January 03, 2025 | Source: News18

Two Indian Navy officers faced a near-accident when their parachutes became entangled during a demonstration rehearsal at Rama Krishna beach in Visakhapatnam. Thankfully, both officers were unharmed.

  • The incident took place on January 3, 2025, as part of a rehearsal for an operational demonstration.
  • A video showed the officers in free fall, with one officer carrying the national flag.
  • Rescue boats were nearby and successfully retrieved the officers after their fall into the sea.
  • The operational demonstration is scheduled for January 4, 2025, with Andhra Pradesh's Chief Minister N Chandrababu Naidu attending as the chief guest.
  • The event will highlight the capabilities of the Indian Navy through a series of visually impressive activities.
The Indian Navy MARCOS are fine. They did not collide; instead, the parachutes had become entangled. The rescue boats were nearby and reached the location where they had fallen. — Akash Sharma on Twitter

This incident serves as a reminder of the commitment of the Indian Navy to operational safety while showcasing their readiness to protect maritime interests.
newTitle: Navy Officers Fall into Beach After Parachute Miscommunication in Andhra Pradesh

title: Mumbai woman kills 62-year-old mother as she ‘loved’ elder sister more - Hindustan Times
IT Ministry notifies draft rules under data protection law - The Hindu
summary:
IT Ministry Notifies Draft Rules Under Data Protection Law

Date: January 3, 2025 | Source: The Hindu

The Union government has released the draft Digital Personal Data Protection (DPDP) Rules, 2025, aimed at enforcing the Digital Personal Data Protection Act, 2023. The rules are now open for public consultation until February 18, 2025.

  • The draft rules outline what data fiduciaries must inform users regarding data collection.
  • Consent managers will be registered to facilitate user consent for data processing.
  • Requirements for safeguarding personal data and obligations for data breach notifications are specified.
  • Provisions regarding the protection of children’s data and deletion of inactive user data are included.
  • Regulations for processing Indian data abroad will be established in the future.
“The submissions will be held in fiduciary capacity in MeitY and shall not be disclosed to anyone at any stage.”

These new rules are aimed at ensuring a structured approach to data protection in India, enhancing user rights and coercing compliance from data fiduciaries.
newTitle: IT Ministry Notifies Draft Rules Under Data Protection Law

title: SP’s office attacked in Manipur’s Kangpokpi, officer leads forces despite injury to the head - The Indian Express
summary:
SP Injured in Kangpokpi Office Attack, Leads Response Against Mob Violence

Date: Friday night
Source: Indian Express

Violence erupted in Manipur’s Kangpokpi district as a mob attacked the Superintendent of Police's office, leaving the SP and others injured. The situation escalated amid protests from Kuki-Zo groups.

  • A mob pelted stones and hurled petrol bombs at the SP office in Kangpokpi, injuring SP Manoj Prabhakar.
  • The violence coincided with a 24-hour shutdown called by the Committee on Tribal Unity in response to earlier confrontations.
  • Security forces were deployed, and the situation was brought under control with the use of adequate force.
  • Fifteen people from the mob were reported injured.
  • Kuki-Zo groups have declared an economic blockade in the region, seeking the removal of security forces after previous conflicts.
“Security forces retaliated and resorted to the use of adequate force to disperse the mob.” - Manipur Police

This violent incident reflects ongoing tensions in the region as conflict continues between Kuki-Zo groups and security forces, demanding attention to the underlying issues.
newTitle: SP Injured in Kangpokpi Office Attack, Leads Response Against Mob Violence

title: Missing Chhattisgarh journalist, 28, found dead in contractor’s septic tank: Police - Hindustan Times
summary:
Missing Chhattisgarh journalist, 28, found dead in contractor’s septic tank: Police

Date: January 03, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

On January 1, a 28-year-old journalist named Mukesh Chandrakar was reported missing and was later found dead in a septic tank on the premises of a contractor in Bijapur, Chhattisgarh. His death is under investigation, and police are exploring potential links to his recent reporting.

  • Mukesh Chandrakar went missing after receiving a call from a local contractor’s cousin.
  • His last known location was traced to the premises of Suresh Chandrakar, the contractor.
  • His body was discovered in a concrete-sealed septic tank, showing signs of violence.
  • Chandrakar previously played a significant role in securing the release of a CRPF commando held by Maoists.
  • Reactions from officials emphasize the risks faced by journalists in exposing the truth.
“As a journalist, my colleague paid the ultimate price for exposing the truth.” - Anurag Dwary, NDTV's resident editor.

Authorities promise a thorough investigation into the murder, highlighting concerns for journalists' safety in the region.
newTitle: Chhattisgarh Journalist Found Dead in Contractor's Septic Tank

title: Katra-Srinagar train likely to chug after Jan 20 - Greater Kashmir
Bhopal hazardous material shift: Two attempt self-immolation in Pithampur - Business Standard
summary:
Protests Erupt in Pithampur Over Hazardous Waste Disposal from Bhopal

Publication Date: Friday, October 2023

Source: PTI

Two individuals attempted self-immolation during ongoing protests against the disposal of hazardous waste from the Bhopal gas tragedy, as tensions rise in Pithampur, Madhya Pradesh.

  • The waste from the Union Carbide factory disaster of 1984 is being transported to Pithampur, triggering significant protests.
  • The Madhya Pradesh High Court had set a deadline for the disposal of the waste, emphasizing the need for action after 40 years.
  • Local residents remain concerned about safety, despite assurances from officials and the Chief Minister regarding the waste's harmlessness.
  • Protests escalate with demonstrations, including involvement from children, demanding the halt of waste incineration.
“The waste comprises 60 per cent mud and 40 per cent naphthol and is not at all harmful.” — Chief Minister Mohan Yadav

The situation reflects ongoing challenges in managing hazardous waste and the community's fears regarding health risks, showcasing the need for transparency and effective communication from authorities.
newTitle: Protests Erupt in Pithampur Over Hazardous Waste Disposal from Bhopal

title: Plea in Ajmer court seeks injunction against PM Modi's Chadar offering to Ajmer Sharif Dargah - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Plea Seeks to Restrain PM Modi from Offering Chadar at Ajmer Sharif Dargah

Date: 03 Jan 2025

Source: Bar and Bench

A plea has been filed in an Ajmer court requesting a temporary injunction to stop Prime Minister Narendra Modi from offering a Chadar at the Ajmer Sharif Dargah during the Urs of Khwaja Moinuddin Chishti, citing ongoing legal disputes over the site's history.

  • The plea was filed by Hindu Sena President Vishnu Gupta.
  • The application argues that the Dargah is built on a site previously occupied by a Shiva temple.
  • Gupta claims that sending a Chadar undermines judicial independence while the case is pending.
  • The Dargah is a significant site, respected for its Sufi heritage.
“This gesture reflects his deep respect for India’s rich spiritual heritage and the enduring message of harmony and compassion,” - Kiren Rijiju

The plea appeals that no chadar should be offered by the Central government amidst the ongoing litigation.
newTitle: Plea Seeks to Restrain PM Modi from Offering Chadar at Ajmer Sharif Dargah

title: PM Modi Launches Delhi Projects, Targets Arvind Kejriwal: 'I Don't Build Sheesh Mahal, I Build Houses' - News18
summary:
PM Modi Launches Delhi Projects, Targets Arvind Kejriwal: 'I Don't Build Sheesh Mahal, I Build Houses'

Date: January 03, 2025 | Source: News18

Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated new development projects in Delhi, including two campuses of Delhi University and various housing initiatives.

  • Inaugurated World Trade Centre at Nauroji Nagar and GPRA Type-II Quarters in Sarojini Nagar.
  • Laid the foundation stone for Veer Savarkar College in Najafgarh.
  • Handed over keys of newly constructed flats to beneficiaries under the In-Situ Slum Rehabilitation Project.
  • Criticized Arvind Kejriwal and the Aam Aadmi Party for their governance in Delhi.
“Today, India has become a symbol of political and economic stability. This role of India will strengthen even more in 2025.” - PM Modi

The projects aim to enhance living conditions and educational infrastructure in Delhi, showcasing the government's commitment to development.
newTitle: PM Modi Launches Delhi Projects, Targets Arvind Kejriwal: 'I Don't Build Sheesh Mahal, I Build Houses'

title: Manipur: Tensions erupt as mob storms Kangpokpi police station against security deployment, SP seen bleeding - Hindustan Times
Fresh violence in Manipur as mob attacks SP office in Kangpokpi district - The Times of India
summary:
Fresh Violence in Manipur: Mob Attacks SP Office in Kangpokpi District

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: The Times of India

An outbreak of violence occurred in Manipur as a mob attacked the office of the Superintendent of Police (SP) in the Kangpokpi district, escalating tensions in the region.

  • The mob targeted the SP office, resulting in significant damage.
  • This incident is part of ongoing unrest in Manipur, which has seen multiple violent incidents recently.
  • Authorities are concerned about the safety of local residents and the potential for further violence.
  • Security forces have been deployed to restore order in the area.
“The violence has created a challenging situation for law enforcement and the local communities.”

This incident reflects the escalating unrest in Manipur, highlighting the urgent need for dialogue and resolution among conflicting groups.
newTitle: Fresh Violence in Manipur: Mob Attacks SP Office in Kangpokpi District

title: Bangladesh asks India to extradite Sheikh Hasina but Yunus made a BIG mistake, now India will... - India.com
summary:
Bangladesh Demands Extradition of Sheikh Hasina from India Amid Rising Tensions

Date: Not provided Source: India.com

Bangladesh has repeatedly demanded the extradition of Sheikh Hasina from India amid escalating tensions between the two nations. The extradition request was sent by the Bangladesh High Commission to India's Ministry of External Affairs on December 23, but experts believe Bangladesh's approach lacks seriousness.

  • Sheikh Hasina has been residing in India since August 5 after fleeing protests in Bangladesh.
  • The extradition request is seen as a means to appease discontent among student groups in Bangladesh.
  • India has not indicated whether it will comply with the extradition demand.
"Extradition is not an easy process... Sheikh Hasina has the right to challenge it legally."

The situation reflects deteriorating relations between India and Bangladesh, particularly under the interim government led by Mohammad Yunus.
newTitle: Bangladesh Demands Extradition of Sheikh Hasina from India Amid Rising Tensions

title: Over 200 Flights Delayed At Delhi Airport As Fog Reduces Visibility Amid Cold Wave In North India - News18
summary:
Over 200 Flights Delayed At Delhi Airport As Fog Reduces Visibility Amid Cold Wave In North India

Date: January 03, 2025
Source: News18

Dense fog has caused major disruptions at Delhi Airport, with over 200 flights delayed as visibility drops amid a cold wave affecting North India.

  • Passengers are advised to check with airlines for updates on their flights.
  • Weather conditions predicted to remain poor in the coming days.
  • Schools in Noida will be closed for classes up to 8.
  • Trains also facing delays, with at least 24 affected by dense fog.
“Due to expected bad weather (poor visibility) in Delhi... all departures/arrivals and their consequential flights might get affected.” - SpiceJet

The ongoing cold wave and dense fog are significantly impacting transportation in and around Delhi, highlighting the adverse weather conditions in the region.
newTitle: Over 200 Flights Delayed At Delhi Airport Due to Fog and Cold Wave

title: CS J&K fixes target of 30,000 installations by March under PM Surya Ghar Yojana - Cross Town News
summary:
CS J&K fixes target of 30,000 installations by March under PM Surya Ghar Yojana

Date: January 3, 2023 Source: Jammu News

The Chief Secretary of Jammu and Kashmir, Atal Dulloo, has set an ambitious target of installing 30,000 solar rooftops across the Union Territory by March as part of the PM Surya Ghar Muft Bijli Yojana. This initiative aims to enhance public awareness and facilitate installations.

  • The meeting focused on the progress of solar rooftop installations.
  • Dulloo emphasized on IEC campaigns to raise public awareness about the initiative.
  • Financial institutions offer loans at a 7% rate to aid installations.
  • A central subsidy of Rs 33,000/kw and a UT subsidy of Rs 3000/kw for domestic consumers were announced.
  • Approximately 11,000 applications received, with 617 installations completed to date.
  • The scheme aims to improve power supply efficiency and reduce AT&C losses.
"Such schemes are reform-oriented with direct benefits accruing to public," said Chief Secretary Atal Dulloo.

The outreach campaign is set to intensify to meet installation targets along with ongoing financial support initiatives for consumers.
newTitle: CS J&K targets 30,000 solar rooftop installations under PM Surya Ghar Yojana by March

title: Section 498A misuse: Supreme Court gives relief to husband, his girlfriend after wife filed domestic viole - The Economic Times
summary:
Supreme Court Ruling on Misuse of Section 498A Offers Relief to Husband and Girlfriend

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: Economic Times

In a significant ruling, the Supreme Court of India provided relief to a husband and his girlfriend after a wife filed allegations against them under Section 498A of the Indian Penal Code. The court determined that the allegations were an abuse of legal process.

Key Points

  • The wife filed an FIR against her husband and his girlfriend, citing domestic violence and dowry demands.
  • The Karnataka High Court initially rejected an appeal by the girlfriend against these allegations.
  • The Supreme Court ruled that a girlfriend cannot be prosecuted under Section 498A as she is not considered a 'relative'.
  • In its judgment, the Supreme Court emphasized that the case against the husband was unfounded and based on insufficient evidence relating to dowry demands.

Notable Quotes

“...the continuation of the criminal proceedings against the appellant herein would be nothing else but an abuse of process of law.”
“By no stretch of imagination would a girlfriend or even a concubine... be a relative.”

Conclusion

This ruling clarifies the legal definition of 'relative' in the context of Section 498A, potentially reducing the misuse of this provision in future cases.
newTitle: Supreme Court Ruling on Misuse of Section 498A Offers Relief to Husband and Girlfriend

title: Landowners entitled to current market value of acquired land when compensation is delayed: Supreme Court - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Rules Landowners Entitled to Current Market Value of Acquired Land Amid Compensation Delays

Published on: 03 Jan 2025, 2:32 pm

The Supreme Court ruled that landowners are entitled to the current market value of acquired land when the government delays compensation payments. This ruling arose from a lengthy legal battle regarding land acquisitions for the Bengaluru-Mysuru Infrastructure Corridor Project (BMICP).

  • The ruling emphasizes the right to property as a human right and a constitutional right under Article 300A.
  • The Supreme Court noted the significant gap in time—compensation for land acquired in 2003 had not been paid until now.
  • The Court directed authorities in Karnataka to determine compensation based on current market value rather than the 2003 value.
“If the compensation to be awarded at the market value as of the year 2003 is permitted, it would amount to permitting a travesty of justice...”

The decision underscores the need for timely compensation and the recognition of inflation's impact over time.
newTitle: Supreme Court Rules Landowners Entitled to Current Market Value of Acquired Land Amid Compensation Delays

title: Dallewal asks farmers to reach Khanauri on Saturday - The Tribune India
summary:
Dallewal Appeals to Farmers for Kisan Mahapanchayat at Khanauri

Publication Date: Not specified Source: The Tribune

Farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal, who is on a 39-day hunger strike, urges farmers to gather in support of the legal guarantee for minimum support price (MSP) at the Kisan Mahapanchayat in Khanauri.

  • Dallewal has been fasting for 39 days and is appealing to farmers to assemble at Khanauri.
  • Farmers are protesting against the BJP-led government over MSP guarantees.
  • The 'Kisan Mahapanchayat' is scheduled for Saturday, aimed at strengthening their demands.
  • Dallewal remains firm on not accepting medical aid during his hunger strike.
  • Despite health concerns, Dallewal plans to address participants briefly at the event.
  • Senior leaders assert that the Centre’s response to their demands is inadequate.
“I want to have your darshan,” - Jagjit Singh Dallewal urging participation.

In conclusion, the farmers’ agitation continues with escalating demands, and Dallewal's health remains a matter of concern as the movement seeks legal assurances for MSP.
newTitle: Dallewal Appeals to Farmers for Kisan Mahapanchayat at Khanauri

title: Cold wave to sweep Telangana for 3 days, minimum temperatures to hover between 2 to 4° C - Telangana Today
Dallewal appeals to farmers to reach Khanauri on january 4 for ‘Kisan Mahapanchayat’ - The Hindu
summary:
Farmers Urged to Attend 'Kisan Mahapanchayat' at Khanauri

Publication Date: January 03, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Farmer leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal has called upon farmers to gather at the Khanauri protest site on January 4, 2024, to strengthen their call for a legal guarantee on the minimum support price (MSP) for crops.

  • Dallewal is on an indefinite hunger strike for 39 days.
  • The farmers have been protesting since their march to Delhi was halted last year.
  • Dallewal has appealed to supporters to attend for his darshan amidst declining health.
“I have decided to sacrifice my life to stop the deaths of farmers. I hope that after my death, the central government will wake up from its slumber and move forward towards fulfilling our 13 demands, including a law on the MSP.” - Jagjit Singh Dallewal

His refusal of medical aid continues as talks with the government remain stalled. The farmers await negotiations with the Centre regarding their demands.
newTitle: Farmers Urged to Attend 'Kisan Mahapanchayat' at Khanauri

title: Srinagar administration issues advisory amid Kashmir snow forecast - Greater Kashmir
Constructive Criticism Of Judgments Helps In Development Of Law; People Guardians Of Judiciary: Justice... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
People of India are guardians of judiciary: Supreme Court Justice CT Ravikumar retires - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
People of India are guardians of judiciary: Supreme Court Justice CT Ravikumar retires

Published on: 03 Jan 2025, 2:03 pm

Justice CT Ravikumar, speaking at his farewell from the Supreme Court, stated that the people of India are the true guardians of the judiciary and the Constitution. He highlighted the importance of constructive criticism in law and expressed his satisfaction with his tenure.

  • Justice Ravikumar emphasized the role of the people in protecting the judiciary.
  • He advocated for constructive criticism regarding public judgments.
  • He expressed satisfaction with his tenure and commitment to uphold public confidence in the judiciary.
  • Ravikumar encouraged patience among lawyers during court proceedings.
  • He addressed the practice of seeking adjournments and their appropriate use.
"I disapprove of what you say but I will defend to the death your right to say it."
"Time has come to bid adieu. I feel great satisfaction but it is for you to say whether it was satisfactory or not."

In conclusion, Justice Ravikumar's farewell call to the legal community highlights the ongoing relationship between the judiciary and the citizens it serves, reinforcing the importance of mutual respect and understanding.
newTitle: Justice CT Ravikumar Emphasizes the Role of People in Safeguarding Judiciary at Farewell Address

title: Modi model vs Kejriwal model: PM draws Delhi battlelines - The Indian Express
summary:
Modi Model vs Kejriwal Model: PM Draws Delhi Battlelines

Publication Date: Date not specified Source: Indian Express

Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched the BJP's campaign for the Delhi Assembly elections, contrasting his government's achievements with those of the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP). He criticized the AAP’s governance model while highlighting the BJP’s initiatives aimed at benefiting the people of Delhi.

  • Modi emphasized the importance of winning Delhi, where the BJP has not held power for over 25 years.
  • He listed numerous infrastructural projects overseen by the BJP government, claiming these initiatives were superior to those undertaken by the AAP.
  • Key areas of focus against the AAP included health, education, and infrastructure, with Modi asserting that the state government had mismanaged funds.
  • Modi inaugurated 1,675 new flats for economically weaker sections, reinforcing his commitment to housing for the poor.
  • He addressed issues regarding the AAP's governance, specifically conflicts with the Lieutenant Governor and criticisms about the AAP's handling of vital services.
“The country knows very well that Modi never built a home for himself... But, in the past 10 years, four crore poor have been given houses.” - Narendra Modi

In conclusion, Modi's address aimed to solidify the BJP’s support in Delhi by contrasting his governance with that of the AAP, emphasizing the theme of development and service to the poor.
newTitle: Modi Model vs Kejriwal Model: PM Draws Delhi Battlelines

title: From Village Boy To Supreme Court Judge : CJI Sanjiv Khanna Lauds Justice CT Ravikumar's Inspirational... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
CJI Sanjiv Khanna Celebrates Justice CT Ravikumar's Inspirational Journey to the Supreme Court

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Live Law

Chief Justice of India Sanjiv Khanna praised Justice CT Ravikumar's remarkable journey from humble beginnings to becoming a Supreme Court Judge at a farewell organized by the Supreme Court Bar Association.

  • CJI Khanna highlighted Justice Ravikumar's determination, discipline, and integrity.
  • Justice Ravikumar, born in a village in Kerala, had a father who worked as a bench clerk in a court.
  • The CJI encouraged young lawyers to aspire for greatness, reflecting on Justice Ravikumar's inspirational journey.
  • Justice Ravikumar annually visits the Sabarimala Temple, embodying values of harmony and respect for all.
  • He emphasized the importance of contribution in life, recalling Justice Ravikumar's quote about the journey from birth to death.
“I see life as B to D - B for birth, D for death and C for contribution in between.”

The event also featured remarks from Attorney General R Venkataramani and SCBA President Kapil Sibal. Justice Ravikumar's retirement reduces Scheduled Caste representation in the Supreme Court from three to two.
newTitle: CJI Sanjiv Khanna Celebrates Justice CT Ravikumar's Inspirational Journey to the Supreme Court

title: 'No Credibility': India Rejects US Media Report On Maldives President's Impeachment Plot - News18
Vande Bharat Sleeper Train Hits Peak Speed Of 180 Kmph During Trials - NDTV
Yogi’s most-trusted officer back as in-charge of all key departments - The Indian Express
summary:
Yogi’s most-trusted officer back as in-charge of all key departments

Publication Date: Late Thursday night | Source: Indian Express

In a significant reshuffle of Uttar Pradesh officers, Sanjay Prasad, a trusted aide of Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath, has regained control over key departments including Home and Vigilance, which were temporarily reassigned before the Lok Sabha elections.

  • Prasad is known for his close ties with Adityanath, having worked with him since 1999.
  • His previous roles included Secretary to the Chief Minister and various district magistrate positions.
  • The Election Commission had previously removed him from the Home Department ahead of the general elections.
  • Prasad’s return consolidates his power within the Uttar Pradesh administration.
“He is alert and responds quickly to situations, which is required for the job he is in.”

Prasad’s reinstatement is seen as a strategy to strengthen the administration ahead of upcoming political challenges.
newTitle: Yogi’s most-trusted officer back as in-charge of all key departments

title: Delhi air pollution: GRAP 3 curbs back in Delhi-NCR amid rise in air pollution levels - The Hindu
summary:
Delhi Air Pollution: GRAP 3 Curbs Back in Delhi-NCR Amid Rise in Air Pollution Levels

Published: January 03, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The Centre's panel on Delhi-NCR's air quality has restored stage 3 curbs under the Graded Response Action Plan due to rising air pollution levels attributed to unfavorable meteorological conditions.

  • Delhi's air quality index (AQI) reached 371 at 4 p.m., indicating very poor air quality.
  • Forecasts suggest further deterioration of air quality in the coming days.
  • The Commission for Air Quality Management has mandated immediate implementation of stage 3 curbs.
  • Stage 3 includes a ban on non-essential construction work and allows hybrid learning for classes up to grade V.
  • Restrictions on the use of BS-III petrol and BS-IV diesel cars in Delhi.
  • Non-essential diesel-operated medium goods vehicles with BS-IV or older standards are also banned.
“It is essential to act now to prevent further worsening of the air quality situation.”

The reinstatement of curbs aims to mitigate the dire air quality situation in Delhi-NCR and protect public health.
newTitle: Delhi Air Quality Crisis: Stage 3 Curbs Reinstated Under GRAP
